summary: Are you aware of any reaction tubers that watch am that ship jyrus?
question: Are you aware of any reaction tubers that watch am that ship jyrus?
answer: Unfortunately no. I think some of the reactors in the fanbase kind of have the same stance that I do - in which they thought it was a cute concept, but once Cyrus’ crush faded, so did their feelings about the potential ship. But we only have a handful of people who react to this show - and it would still be very interesting to see reactions and opinions from people with different opinions, who are actually respectful unlike………..certain people.

summary: Id like to get your opinion on something if tyrus was a straight ship (Cyrus is a girl and tj the boy) do you think tyrus would...
question: Id like to get your opinion on something if tyrus was a straight ship (Cyrus is a girl and tj the boy) do you think tyrus would be as shipped as they are?
answer:
No - or at least not by the same people - because their relationship wouldn’t be the same, nor would the characters. While being gay is not anyone’s entire identity, it does shape who they are. And Cyrus Goodman definitely would not be the same character if he were not a gay man. The same goes for TJ - although we don’t see as much from his point of view, knowing that he is gay provides a lot of context for the audience about who he is and why. 

Beyond how it would altar the characters themselves - the way an audience connects to a character/relationship has a lot to do with the amount of support they receive. That’s a key part in storytelling, especially in television. Most people try to find things they can identify with and relate to in the shows they watch. And part of the reason so many people ship Tyrus is because of the LGBTQ+ representation and validation it provides. 

A relationship of the same dynamic would not have the same impact if it were between a cisgender heterosexual pairing. That’s not to say that some people wouldn’t still ship it, because I’m sure they would. And it would still be a very healthy example of a relationship - but there would definitely be some depth missing and it wouldn’t be nearly as groundbreaking. We’ve seen straight ships do the whole “help each other become better people” thing before. We haven’t seen it in the context of a healthy young gay pairing before, and it’s important, and that is at least, in part, why a lot of people support this relationship.

summary:
*Buffy runs into TJ, who is carrying a bouquet of roses*
Buffy: Lemme guess, those are for Cyrus?
TJ: Duh.
Buffy: Y'know,...
body:
*Buffy runs into TJ, who is carrying a bouquet of roses*

Buffy: Lemme guess, those are for Cyrus?

TJ: Duh.

Buffy: Y'know, Valentine’s Day was three whole days ago, so you can stop showering him with gifts and decorating his locker with candy hearts now.

TJ: What’re you talking about?? I do stuff like this everyd-

TJ: Hold up, Valentine’s Day was this month??

Buffy:

Buffy: Nevermind, then.

Here’s the summary:
"The rivalry between Jefferson High and Salt...
body:
Chapter 1 of ‘Swingsets and Dance Routines’ is officially up!!

Here’s the summary:

“The rivalry between Jefferson High and Salt Lake Academy was infamous, and every year it only seemed to grow more heated. Cyrus couldn’t help but think it had officially passed the point of being ‘friendly competition.’”

~

Or the one where TJ and Cyrus are from rival schools, and one chance encounter at a cafe ends up changing a whole more than Cyrus had anticipated for.

summary: I vehemently disagree that tyrus as a ship is somehow providing better representation for the LGBTQ+ community.  The only thing...
question: I vehemently disagree that tyrus as a ship is somehow providing better representation for the LGBTQ+ community.  The only thing exceptional about it is the channel running the show but the cute dork falls for mean jock that turns out to be nice trope is already played out to death and back even in for LGBTQ+.  Smurf has a jyrus obsession problem not a tyrus hate problem and even if jyrus were canon instead it'd be the same just maybe not as hidden since jonah is a main character unlike tj.
answer:
My point was that Tyrus is providing us with more gay rep because it is the only ship on the show that actually includes two canonically gay characters. Shipping Jyrus or any other non canon ship is fine, but doing it to the point where you are against the relationship on the show that is actually canon and providing real representation and validation is problematic at the least. I’ve always said that if the writers had decided to make Jyrus happen, I would have supported it for the representation alone - because supporting that kind of rep is more important than my personal preferences of pairings. Its not about the actual relationship, but like it or not Tyrus IS providing better representation for the lgbtq community than any other ship for the show because it is the ONLY ship on the show that involves two people who are canonically not straight. And Smurf does have an anti Tyrus problem but that it literally the least of my issues with him……….like imagine reading that entire post about how he is a shitty dude and still only making it about ships lmao.

ps ship wars are fucking dumb so let me be clear: this isn’t tyrus vs. jyrus for me. it is about the fact that tyrus is providing representation and validation. if y'all start sending me a bunch of ship war stuff i will probably just delete it unless it is something that actually provides an interesting thing to talk about. and if any hate starts, y'all are just gonna get blocked k thnx bye.

body:
Future Happiness

When I am an adult and I get sad, I’m just going to watch an Andi Mack episode and then something that one of the actors had done recently. It may make me feel old, but it will also make me so proud because this cast is amazing.
